alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:54PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cook and northeastern Lake Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 552 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over northeastern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, or 16 miles west of Gunflint Lake, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Saganaga Lake around 555 PM CDT. Alpine Lake around 600 PM CDT. Sea Gull Lake around 605 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Gunflint Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. If on or near Sea Gull, Saganaga, or Gunflint Lakes, get off or out of the water. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter inside a vehicle or sturdy structure now! Do not be caught on or in the water during a thunderstorm.
